metadata.title: CVE-2021-47361 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mcb: fix error handling in mcb_alloc_bus()There are two bugs:1) If ida_simple_get() fails then this code calls put_device(carrier)   but we haven't yet called get_device(carrier) and probably that   leads to a use after free.2) After device_initialize() then we need to use put_device() to   release the bus.  This will free the internal resources tied to the   device and call mcb_free_bus() which will free the rest.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
